text:
Dalit IAS officer Shashi Karnawat, who is under suspension in a graft case, on Sunday dropped her plan to end her life by taking ‘jal samadhi’ (drowning) in river Narmada in Khandwa district on February 2.Another Dalit IAS officer Ramesh Thete, speaking on behalf of Ms. Karnawat, said State Finance Minister Jayant Malaiya had been in touch with him ever since Ms. Karnawat began ‘maun vrat’.

Mr. Thete said the State had softened its stand on her two demands: on reinstating her and paying her 75 per cent of the wages during the suspension period instead of the 50 per cent she is currently getting. The time had come to reinstate Ms. Karnawat as the MP High Court had admitted a petition challenging her conviction, he said. — PTI
title: Dalit officer drops plan to take ‘jal samadhi’
